keywords: Thanksgiving: How to Cook it Well
name: Sam Sifton's Roasted Cauliflower with Anchovy Bread Crumbs
description: While mashed potatoes and green beans are no-brainers come Thanksgiving, that additional side dish or two can be a bit of a toss-up. That's where Sam Sifton's Roasted Cauliflower with Anchovy Bread Crumbs from Thanksgiving: How to Cook it Well comes in—pop it into the oven while your turkey rests. Roasted cauliflower is awesome on its own, at once creamy and caramelized, but the addition of crunchy anchovy bread crumbs takes the dish into Thanksgiving territory.
recipeIngredient: 8 to 10 fresh sage leaves, roughly chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
8 anchovy fillets, rinsed and finely chopped
3 cloves garlic, peeled and finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Break cauliflower into florets and toss in a bowl with sage, lemon zest, sugar, and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and spread out on a large baking sheet. Place in oven and cook until tender and golden, approximately 20 to 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare bread crumbs. Heat olive oil in a sauté pan set over medium heat. When oil shimmers, add the anchovies, garlic, shallot, and bread crumbs. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes, until golden.
In a large bowl, toss together cauliflower and bread crumbs and serve on a warmed platter.
